channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: And Bloomberg‚Äî there‚Äôs no amount of money they should take to further tarnish their name than Exxon. When I hear the name Bloomberg on Twitter this is what I think of now: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt click. Paywall.‚Äù

What a disgusting combo. Fuck you bloomberg and esp fuck you Exxon, we don‚Äôt need to capture fucking carbon that was never fucking dumped into our fucking atmosphere. https://t.co/pAE6zPvOaZ
Exxon is one of those names like Hitler and Facebook that they should change because you might as well call your company Evil Corp or somesuch.
Wordle 270 4/6 ‚¨úüü®‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú ‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨úüü®‚¨ú üü®üü©üü©üü©‚¨ú üü©üü©üü©üü©üü©

The senate Repubs approved billions in aid to Ukraine, but denied Americans help in fighting a war in the US which has already claimed a million American lives, and isn‚Äôt yet over. Repubs again.
This is a replay of the war in Iraq. Yes it‚Äôs important to help Ukraine, but senators, it‚Äôs your JOB to help Americans. Aren‚Äôt Repubs the ones who say ‚ÄúAmericans First‚Äù all the time..
Kurt Vonnegut once called Bob Dylan the ‚Äòworst poet alive.‚Äô https://t.co/HaBa2bEtLH
Sorry ‚ÄúTrump lied‚Äù hasn‚Äôt been news since 2016. https://t.co/wFFStlLJLL
RNC sues Salesforce to block Jan. 6 committee data dump. https://t.co/U0GNUUn3ES
New York Times takes down third-party Wordle Archive. https://t.co/AbjkbJ3f6X
Google opens a domain registrar. https://t.co/KMi6Barzaw
@tcarmody yup
The Repubs and some Dems think they can make Covid go away by legislating it out of existence. Oh they are so stupid, and we're about to pay the price, again, for their stupidity.

Twitter is still the easiest blogging platform out there. Just add titles, styling and links, and get rid of the character limit and Twitter will own the world. Hopefully with the new management they will do this.
Why is it OK with me? They have a fine API. I've got good support for it in my scripting environment. They run the servers, that's OK with me.
https://t.co/AAPZx5EmMH
There's going to be a lot of consolidation in the streaming world. There are too many subscriptions. Here's the latest offer I got in my mailbox. https://t.co/lBbAHjjk6r
Would Ukraine consider making us honorary citizens?
@momoetomo PS: I've read it before. ;-)
I've been trying various kinds of marinated veggies in my salads. Here's the latest. I'll let you know how it goes. https://t.co/FIP27kRQZD
I ordered Maus when it was banned, on backorder. It came today. https://t.co/viijGZXH4L
The US Tried Permanent Daylight Saving Time in the '70s. People Hated It. https://t.co/aOkANnTiXm
@IAPonomarenko @KyivPost They do that a lot. I went to the 2008 Democratic national convention and heard from friends that CNN was covering the demonstrations. There were no demonstrations.

something funny. A semi-famous pundit took an ad on Facebook. This person had been incredibly obnoxious to me, on Twitter, jaw-dropping obnoxious. Over on Facebook I chose the menu item asking why I was seeing this ad. said she wanted to reach people like herself. Ohdeeohdoh!
Drummer: About Drummer. https://t.co/OQ4WaWCpph
@twwilliams I like to write docs for people to read. üòÅ

Posted 5 years ago. In the future you will be able to experience the world audibly and visually through the eyes of anyone wearing special glasses,
or fly through the physical world with one of millions of drones scattered all over the planet and in earth orbit. With appropriate ads of course.
